name: air separation facility construction | air separation facility | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/7237/documentation

This dataset represents a facility construction for air separation process. In this dataset, there are large uncertainties for equipment used due to weak data from small air separation plants. The plant refers to an estimated air separation plant with 80'000 t liquid products per year, and it accounts for an assumed life time of 20 years.;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]

From an unknown land to industrial area, used to build up the facility.

This activity ends with the dismantling of the air separation facility. The dataset includes the aluminium for the column and cold resistant steel for the piping, low-alloyed steel and various other materials in the compressors, cladding and other components. Besides the infrastructure in this module also the land use of the plant is included. This dataset is only a rough approximation for the infrastructure and land use of an air separation plant. The dataset does not include energy for construction processes.
category: F:Construction/42:Civil engineering/429:Construction of other civil engineering projects/4290:Construction of other civil engineering projects

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data partly from U.S. plant producer.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Extrapolation small plants with a production volume of 0.1-3 t per hour to a larger plant with 10 t per hour production.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Estimation from weak data of smaller plants.

exchanges.description:
Air separation plant with a liquid product output of 0.08 Mt a-1 or 1.6 Mt during the whole lifetime (20 years) of the site. Per kg of liquid product therefore a share of 625 * 10-12 units of the infrastructure is needed.
EcoSpold01Location=RER

flow.name: air separation facility
flow.category: F:Construction/42:Civil engineering/429:Construction of other civil engineering projects/4290:Construction of other civil engineering projects

exchanges.description:
EcoSpold01Location=RER
Estimated from data of small plants. The infrastructure of the air separation plant contains besides cold resistant steel and aluminium for the piping and the column also low-alloyed steel and various other materials in the compressors and other components. . The weight of the equipment is largely dependent of the size of the plant. For small plants with an output of 100 kg liquefied product per hour a plant weight of 8-10 t is common. For very large plants the specific weight (referred to the output per hour) of the plant is estimated to be more than 10 times smaller. For this inventory an amount of 10 kg per kg hourly production output was assumed. This leads to a total plant weight of 100 t. 10% of the total weight was accounted as aluminium for the column. The rest was assumed to be a similar material composition as used for the production facilities in the chemical industry.

Estimated from data of small plants. The infrastructure of the air separation plant contains besides cold resistant steel and aluminium for the piping and the column also low-alloyed steel and various other materials in the compressors and other components. . The weight of the equipment is largely dependent of the size of the plant. For small plants with an output of 100 kg liquefied product per hour a plant weight of 8-10 t is common. For very large plants the specific weight (referred to the output per hour) of the plant is estimated to be more than 10 times smaller. For this inventory an amount of 10 kg per kg hourly production output was assumed. This leads to a total plant weight of 100 t. 10% of the total weight was accounted as aluminium for the column. The rest was assumed to be a similar material composition as used for the production facilities in the chemical industry.

defaultProvider.category: F:Construction/42:Civil engineering/429:Construction of other civil engineering projects/4290:Construction of other civil engineering projects

exchanges.description: Estimated from data of small plants. For the time of occupation 20 years were assumed as plant lifetime, thus a total of 20000 m2*year was obtained.

Estimated from data of small plants. The land use of the air separation plant depends on the size of the plant. For small plants with an output of 100 kg liquefied product per hour a space requirement of 0.3 m2 per kg hourly production is reported. For larger plants with an output of 3000 kg liquefied product per hour the space requirement lowers to 0.2 m2 per kg hourly production. For very large plants the land use was estimated to be about 0.1 m2 per kg hourly production. For this inventory an average amount of 0.1 m2 per kg hourly production output was assumed. This leads to a total area occupied by the plant of 1000 m2.

Further references:

Cosmodyne (2001) Performance Specifications, Aspen 1000 / Aspen 2000. Cosmodyne, Torrance, (CA, USA). Retrieved 16.01.2002 from www.cosmodyne.com

Estimated from data of small plants. For the disposal it was assumed that the aluminium column is recycled and therefore no disposal process was included for this part. For the rest of the plant the process "decommissioned chemical production facilities‚Äù is applied.

exchanges.description: Estimated from data of small plants. One year of occupation as construction site for construction and dismantling was assumed.  The occupation of the area before the occupation as industrial area is not known (transformation from unknown).

Estimated from data of small plants. The land use of the air separation plant depends on the size of the plant. For small plants with an output of 100 kg liquefied product per hour a space requirement of 0.3 m2 per kg hourly production is reported. For larger plants with an output of 3000 kg liquefied product per hour the space requirement lowers to 0.2 m2 per kg hourly production. For very large plants the land use was estimated to be about 0.1 m2 per kg hourly production. For this inventory an average amount of 0.1 m2 per kg hourly production output was assumed. This leads to a total area occupied by the plant of 1000 m2.

Further references:

Cosmodyne (2001) Performance Specifications, Aspen 1000 / Aspen 2000. Cosmodyne, Torrance, (CA, USA). Retrieved 16.01.2002 from www.cosmodyne.com
